skills.description: The ability to transform business requirements into clear, unambiguous technical specifications that can be directly implemented by developers or AI agents.

proficiency_levels.beginner: Can write basic feature descriptions with simple acceptance criteria.
proficiency_levels.intermediate: Can create comprehensive specs with edge cases, error handling scenarios, and clear input/output definitions.
proficiency_levels.advanced: Can write specs that anticipate integration challenges, include performance considerations, and provide exhaustive test case coverage.

required_for: Writing feature specifications for Add/List/Update/Delete/Toggle tasks
Creating acceptance criteria for each CLI command
Documenting edge cases
Defining test cases for validation
success_criteria: Spec is clear and implementable without further clarification
No ambiguity in requirements or expected behavior
All edge cases explicitly documented
Acceptance criteria are testable and measurable

skills.description: The ability to design scalable, maintainable, and testable software structures with proper separation of concerns.

proficiency_levels.beginner: Can organize code into separate files and folders. Understands basic concepts of modules and imports.
proficiency_levels.intermediate: Can design clean separation of concerns (Models/Storage/Commands/Utils). Applies SOLID principles consistently.
proficiency_levels.advanced: Can design architectures that anticipate growth. Implements patterns like Repository, Command, Factory appropriately.

required_for: Designing the TODO CLI project structure
Separating domain models from storage logic
Creating command handlers for CLI operations
Planning component interactions and data flow
success_criteria: Each module has a single, clear responsibility
Dependencies flow in one direction
Components can be tested in isolation
No circular dependencies exist

skills.description: Proficiency in writing production-quality Python code following modern best practices including PEP 8, type hints, and proper error handling.

proficiency_levels.beginner: Can write functional Python code. Understands basic data structures, functions, and classes.
proficiency_levels.intermediate: Writes PEP 8 compliant code with type hints. Uses dataclasses. Implements proper exception handling.
proficiency_levels.advanced: Leverages Python 3.13+ features. Writes comprehensive type annotations. Implements custom exceptions hierarchy.

required_for: Implementing the Task model with proper attributes
Building CLI interface with argument parsing
Creating in-memory storage with CRUD operations
Implementing input validation and error handling
success_criteria: Code passes PEP 8 linting
All functions have type hints
Docstrings follow Google/NumPy style
No bare except clauses

skills.description: The ability to effectively communicate with AI coding assistants to generate high-quality, accurate code.

proficiency_levels.beginner: Can write basic prompts that describe what code is needed.
proficiency_levels.intermediate: Crafts prompts with clear constraints, examples, and expected outputs. Breaks complex features into atomic tasks.
proficiency_levels.advanced: Designs prompt chains for complex multi-step implementations. Anticipates AI limitations and works around them.

required_for: Generating implementation code for each feature
Breaking the 5 features into atomic coding tasks
Iterating on generated code to fix issues
Providing context about project architecture to AI
success_criteria: Prompts produce usable code on first or second attempt
Tasks are atomic enough to be completed in single interactions
AI outputs align with project architecture and standards

skills.description: The ability to systematically evaluate code for correctness, quality, maintainability, and adherence to standards.

proficiency_levels.beginner: Can identify obvious bugs and style issues. Checks if code runs and produces expected output.
proficiency_levels.intermediate: Reviews against PEP 8 and project standards systematically. Validates SOLID principles adherence.
proficiency_levels.advanced: Evaluates architectural decisions and long-term maintainability. Identifies subtle bugs and security issues.

required_for: Validating AI-generated code quality
Ensuring PEP 8 compliance across all files
Verifying SOLID principles are followed
Testing edge cases for each feature
success_criteria: All code follows PEP 8 style guidelines
SOLID principles are consistently applied
Edge cases are handled correctly
No security vulnerabilities

skills.description: The ability to create clear, comprehensive, and maintainable documentation for different audiences.

proficiency_levels.beginner: Can write basic README with installation and usage instructions.
proficiency_levels.intermediate: Creates comprehensive READMEs with examples and troubleshooting. Writes clear docstrings.
proficiency_levels.advanced: Creates documentation systems that scale. Maintains specs history for traceability.

required_for: Writing the project README with installation and usage
Creating usage examples for all 5 CLI commands
Documenting the architecture and design decisions
Writing inline docstrings for all modules
success_criteria: README enables new user to install and use CLI in under 5 minutes
All public functions have docstrings
Usage examples cover common scenarios and edge cases
Documentation is accurate and matches current code

skills.description: The ability to plan, organize, track, and execute software projects effectively.

proficiency_levels.beginner: Can create basic task lists and track completion. Understands the concept of dependencies.
proficiency_levels.intermediate: Breaks features into well-sized tasks with clear definitions of done. Identifies and manages task dependencies.
proficiency_levels.advanced: Creates comprehensive project plans with contingencies. Optimizes task ordering for parallel work.

required_for: Breaking the 5 features into implementable tasks
Sequencing work based on dependencies
Tracking progress through implementation
Managing risks and ensuring quality standards
success_criteria: All 5 features are broken into atomic tasks
Task dependencies are identified and respected
Progress is visible and trackable
Quality gates are defined and enforced
